intro: Cacalia kangxianensis, commonly known as the Kangxian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, herbaceous stems and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
